node.title: No cobwebs for Devine, Blaze dominate Brave in record-low T20 total
node.description: The White Ferns skipper barely raised a sweat, as Wellington dominated at Cobham Oval.
node.content: ["White Ferns captain Sophie Devine has had no trouble settling back into New Zealand soil, helping lead her Super Smash side Wellington Blaze to an emphatic eight wicket victory over the Northern Brave at Whangarei's Cobham Oval.", "In her first appearance on an Aotearoa pitch since the White Ferns' opening T20 against Australia at Seddon Park last March, Devine scored an unbeaten 20 runs to cruise past the hosts' record-low total of 46.", "The 32-year-old opening batter took no time chasing down the total, hitting a four on her second ball, and a six to win the match.", "But it was Wellington's bowling extraordinaire's who created some unwanted history for Northern.", "The Braves total surpassed New Zealand's previous lowest T20 score - Central Hinds 56 against the Blaze at Lincoln two seasons ago.", "Wellington's off-spinner Xara Jetly claimed incredible figures of 4/1 off three overs, right after White Ferns Amelia Kerr took 3/9.\u00a0", "\"It's pretty unreal, but then again it was a team effort,\" says Jetly. \"The openers [Jess Kerr] and Sophie [Devine] really set the tone there for me and made it a bit easier for me\"", "\u201cThe last thing that [coach] Lance Dry told me was: 85 percent of the time was to bowl at the stumps, and I hope that he\u2019s happy.", "\u201cMy game plan is pretty simple, it\u2019s just to bowl at the stumps and vary that pace a lot, that tends to be my strength, and force the batters to play a shot every time.\u201d", "Choosing to bat first, Northern was quickly reduced to 27/2 thanks to Kerr sisters Amelia and Jess, and it only went downhill for the hosts from there.", "Amelia then finished off her figures after boasting two wickets in two balls, reducing the Brave to 32/5.", "And then it was Jetly's time to shine, taking one, and then taking the final three wickets all in one over.", "The win makes it eight from eight for the Blaze, who sit comfortably at the top of the Super Smash ladder, and are inching closer and closer to their fourth T20 title in five years."]
